newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: EA-Generali consortium says may lose CA bid - paper.
newsitem.headline: EA-Generali consortium says may lose CA bid - paper.

text.p: A group of bidders for Austria's Creditanstalt led by insurer EA-Generali acknowledged on Friday its chances of topping a rival bid by Bank Austria were small, Austrian daily Kurier said.

"Unfortunately, this has become a political deal," the paper quoted an unnamed member of the consortium as saying in its Saturday edition, made available late on Friday. "We see our chances as being very, very slim."
EA-Generali representatives were not immediately available for comment.

The group has bid a total of 13.8 billion schillings for the state's 19.9 million shares in the bank and wants to sell about a quarter of those on the market at a premium, 60 percent of which would also go to the government's coffers.
"We will top up our offer slightly, but we simply can't match the price offered by Bank Austria," another influential member of the group said, according to the paper.
Bank Austria has bid 16.8 billion schillings for the government's 70 percent voting stake in Creditanstalt. Both suitors have until January 10 to update their offers.

Bank Austria's bid is preferred by Austria's dominant Social Democrats, while their junior coalition partner, the conservative People's Party, prefers the consortium. The debate has caused a growing rift among the partners.
